text: An amulet (from Latin amuletum, meaning "charm"), is an object that people think will bring good luck and or protection to its owner. Usually amulets are gems, statues, coins, drawings, pendants, rings, plants, animals, etc. Even words can be amulets, such as vade retro satanaâ€”(Latin, "go back, Satan"), to make bad luck go away. Category:Superstitions
title: Amulet
